ref: 2773 kambalin ʻ wearing a blanket ʼ Jain. [kambalá -- 1]
Pa. kambalin -- ʻ having a woollen garment ʼ;
Mth. kamariā ʻ a working man ʼ;
M. kã̄bḷyā m. ʻ common labourer ʼ. -- Poss. belong here
G. kāmḷiyɔ m. ʻ hairy caterpillar ʼ;

N. kamalā ʻ a kind of winged insect which buries dead insects, caterpillar (?) ʼ or are these formed by pop. etym. for *kavaṇ -- < kapanā́ -- f. ʻ worm, caterpillar ʼ RV. for which EWA i 154 suggests some conn. with the
